alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 5:39AM PST until January 30 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Moderate to locally heavy snow is expected. Snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inch are expected at elevations between 3000 and 4500 feet, with 4 to 8 inches above 4500 feet. Highest snowfall totals are expected in the eastern San Gabriel Mountains, where local totals up to 12 inches are possible in the higher terrain. Southwest winds will gust as high as 40 mph this afternoon and evening, with easterly winds potentially gusting to 35 to 45 mph on Monday. * WHERE...Los Angeles County Mountains. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 10 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow accumulation possible on area roadways down to around 3000 feet including portions of Interstate 5 from the Grapevine to north of Castaic, as well as the higher portions of Highway 14 near Agua Dulce and Acton.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions from CalTrans are available by calling 1 800 4 2 7 7 6 2 3.
